Sentence.sentence: There're steps we can take that would make some difference, and Mayor Rahm Emanuel is trying some of them—yet the union is resisting.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: It estimated that step would save hundreds of billions of dollars over the next decade.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Frederick's central idea, that stove, sink and kitchen table must be placed in such a relation that useless steps are avoided entirely, inspired the first fully fitted kitchen, designed in the 1920s by Margarete Schütter-Libotsky.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Yet the persistent question of Why do I need that? – or, perhaps more  tellingly,  Why  do  you  need  to  know  that?  –  dogs  the  steps  of  many  new  ventures.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The newer players are stepping into what they view as a treasure house of resources.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The Paris agreement has been widely hailed as a positive step forward in addressing climate change for all,  although the details on addressing climate justice can be best described as sketchy.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Plain packaging would be another step in the reclassification of cigarettes from inviting consumer products to narcotics ( ' , 麻醉剂).
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Companies  have  already  won  part  of  the  battle,  having  driven  tech  into  every  part  of  our  lives,  tracking  our steps and our very heartbeats.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Throughout these series, you will learn more about the profession, the necessary steps to get a social work degree, the rich history of social work and many ways that social workers help others.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Stacy is going to walk you through the step-by-step process of becoming a social worker and Mill will tell you about the range of options you have once you get your social work degree, as well as the high standards of responsibility the social workers must adhere to.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: These students need to build skills and knowledge during college if they are to use their degrees as a stepping- stone to middle-class mobility.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Perhaps a new phrase is needed, one that can bring everyone one big step closer to realizing Du Bois's original, idealistic hope: It's not the name—it's the Thing that counts..
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Oprah Winfrey's honorary doctorate was a step in the wrong direction.
Sentence.come: 出自-2014年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: One critical step that could help to drive change would be to require Ph.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: But rarely, if ever, do they publicly take the argument a step further, asserting that a growing manufacturing sector encourages craftsmanship and that craftsmanship is, if not a birthright, then a vital ingredient of the American self-image as a can-do, inventive, we-can-make-anything people.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Taking a step that many professors may view as a bit counterproductive, some colleges and universities are doling out Apple iPhones and Internet-capable iPods to their students
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: I don't attend services when I am there, and I have never meditated, there or anywhere; I just take walks and read and lose myself in the stillness, recalling that it is only by stepping briefly away from my wife and bosses and friends that I will have anything useful to bring to them.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: And so your next step should be to discuss your concerns with your teacher or the principal.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: In fact, every step of the way, as (usually) Democratic leaders have tried to introduce work-family balance measures into the law, business groups have been strongly opposed
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: A human-shaped robot won't be stepping into your car to drive it.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: This year's shuttle mission is a big step in space exploration.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Although many people say the new Barbies are a step in the right direction, some people say they don't go far enough.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section B

Sentence.sentence: Perhaps a new phrase is needed, one that can bring everyone one big step closer to realizing Du Bois' original, idealistic hope: "It's not the name — It's the Thing that counts. "
Sentence.come: 2015年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Scientists can use a DOI to publish each step of the research life cycle, not just the final paper.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: The author believes the researchers’ new study has gone a step further regarding the impact of screen time on well-being.

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个名词均含"步，步态"之意。
means: step ： 普通用词，指脚抬起落下的动作和一步的距离。抽象概念指步骤。
pace ： 指身体向前移动的速度和情况。表一步距离时，可与step换用。

word_mean: 阶梯，步级，梯级：不同水平上的一系列脚踏板，或类似的结构
在加工表面（或装配时的连接面）和加工（或装配）工具、主轴转速及进给量不变的情况下，所连续完成的那一部分作业。
升降法, step-up and down method

Sentence.sentence: A grasp of how to manage color in your spaces is one of the first steps to creating rooms you'll love to live in.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语全国卷I 阅读理解 七选五 原文

Sentence.sentence: A new commodity brings about a highly profitable, fast-growing industry, urging antitrust反垄断regulators to step in to check those who control its flow.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: According to Jennifer Debruyn, the next step of the study is to find out the source of the enzyme.

Sentence.sentence: As the end of school approaches, and school vacation reading lists loom ahead, parents might take this chance to step in and make their own summer reading list and plan a family trip to the library or bookstore.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语全国卷2 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: But the next step is making sure that you remember what you've read!  You may have just read the text, but the ideas, concepts and images (形象) may fly right out of your head.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语浙江卷（11月） 阅读理解 七选五 原文

Sentence.sentence: By connecting directly with customers, and by responding quickly to changes in the markets as well as in the ecosystems (生态系统), small farmers can keep one step ahead of the big guys.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: Color choices in this range are a step up from the small ones in two major ways.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语全国卷I 阅读理解 七选五 原文

Sentence.sentence: Experts say Paris is right: for a sudden heart failure, the single best chance for survival is having someone nearby step in and do CPR quickly.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: Give your body and brain a rest by stepping outside for a while, exercising, or dong something you enjoy.

Sentence.sentence: Great things happen when you step out of your comfort zone, and you would be surprised on how many chances exist if you just ask.

Sentence.sentence: I guess that there's probably some demanding work schedule, or social anxiety around stepping up to help for an unknown sport.

Sentence.sentence: I started climbing up those strangely mysterious steps.

Sentence.sentence: If the steps you take are working, keep it up.

Sentence.sentence: If you feel stressed by responsibilities at work, you should take a step back and identify those of greater and less importance.

Sentence.sentence: Imagine my surprise when I stepped foot onto UCR's campus, where over 400 organizations exist, ranging from political organizations to karate club.

Sentence.sentence: In the weeks that followed, the solution which had come up in my unconscious mind provided correct at every step.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语天津卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: In this instance, step away from your keyboard to allow everyone to calm down.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语天津卷 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: It's understandable, but if you're willing to build trust in a relationship again, we have some steps you can take to get you there.

Sentence.sentence: She would have to cross it by stepping from sleeper to sleeper.

Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语天津卷 阅读理解 阅读表达 原文

Sentence.sentence: They recognize there's something missing in their lives, but it's hard to step off the track.

Sentence.sentence: In facts, the more new things we try- the more we step outside our comfort zone - the more inherently creative we become, both in the workplace and in our personal lives.
Sentence.come: 出自-2009年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Relying on ethical persuasion rather than law to address the misuse of body ideals may be the best step.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: As an executive coach, I’ve seen image upgrades be particularly helpful during transitions---when looking for a new job, stepping into a new or more public role, or changing work environments.

Sentence.sentence: There is one step the TSA could take that would not require remodeling airports or rushing to hire: Enroll more people in the PreCheck program.

Sentence.sentence: The court’s ruling is a step forward in the struggle against both corruption and official favoritism.

Sentence.sentence: The latter step would largely offset the financial burden of annually pre-funding retiree health care, thus addressing a long-standing complaint by the USPS and its union.

Sentence.come: 2009年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Now, a new Web-based company has taken it a step further and developed the first "brain training program" designed to actually help people improve and regain their mental sharpness.

Sentence.come: 2016年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

means.word_mean: 脚步, 步

sentences.en: I won't venture a step farther.
sentences.cn: 我不敢再往前走一步。

means.word_mean: 一步的距离, 短距离

sentences.en: He stood within five steps of me.
sentences.cn: 他站在离我不到五步远的地方。

means.word_mean: 楼梯, 台阶

sentences.en: She was standing on the church steps.
sentences.cn: 她正站在教堂门前的台阶上。

means.word_mean: 级别, 等级; 阶段

sentences.en: A colonel is three steps above a captain.
sentences.cn: 上校比上尉的级别高三级。

means.word_mean: 步骤, 措施

sentences.en: He will approve such steps.
sentences.cn: 他会同意这些措施的。

means.word_mean: 步伐；步态
舞步
踏板操
折梯；梯子
脚步声
脚印，足迹
步伐一致，步调合拍
阶段，步骤；手段，措施
(登山时凿出的)踏脚处；(采矿时凿用的)岩架
举步, 行走, 跨步, 迈步, 踏

sentences.en: He stepped backward and fell over the cliff.
sentences.cn: 他向后退了一步就从悬崖上掉下去了。

sentences.en: He steps the pavements.
sentences.cn: 他在人行道上行走。

means.word_mean: (跳舞时)合着节拍走
(尤指马)轻快地走；快速移动(或行进)

sentences.en: She stepped briskly out of the club.
sentences.cn: 她快步走出了夜总会。

means.word_mean: 离开(along)

sentences.en: He has stepped along.
sentences.cn: 他已经走了。

means.word_mean: 一下子陷入特定状态
跳(舞)
步测
使成阶梯状；逐步(或分段)安排；在(山坡等)上凿出阶梯
【航海学】把(桅杆)竖立在桅座上；在船上安装(甲板等)  </seg>

data.mean: step in 居间调停；居中斡旋；援之以手
in/out of step (with sb/sth) （和某人）步伐一致（或不一致）；（和音乐）合拍（或不合拍）
step forward 主动站出来（帮忙或提供信息）；自告奋勇
step sth↔up 增加，提高（数量、速度等）

fixed_phrase_list.cn: 走路小心；言行小心谨慎

sentence.cn: 通过直接与客户建立联系，并快速响应市场和生态系统的变化，小农户可以领先大农场主。

sentence.en: If you feel stressed by responsibilities at work,  you should take a step back and identify (识别) those of greater and less importance.

means.word_mean: 走
其他释义

jx.jx_en_mean: stop walking or marching in step with others
change the way one is walking so that one is walking in step with another person
putting (or not putting) one's feet forward alternately in the same rhythm as the people one is walking, marching, or dancing with
jx.jx_cn_mean: （不与他人一起）走齐步（或合拍跳舞）

jx.jx_en_mean: do as someone else did, especially in making a journey or following a career
jx.jx_cn_mean: （尤指旅行或事业上）踏 着…的脚步走；效 法…的样子，步…的后尘

jx.jx_en_mean: remain walking, marching, or dancing in step
used as a warning to someone to walk or act carefully
managing to avoid competition or danger from someone or something
jx.jx_cn_mean: 尽量避免同…的竞争；设法避开危险

lj.lj_ly: I try to keep one step ahead of the rest of the staff.
lj.lj_ls: 我尽量避免同其他工作人员的竞争。

lj.lj_ly: I try to keep one step ahead of the rest of the staff.
lj.lj_ls: 我尽量避免同其他工作人员的竞争。

jx.jx_en_mean: take control of a task or job from another person

phrase.cizu_name: step on it (或 step on the gas)

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)go faster, typically in a motor vehicle
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)赶快；加快车速，踩油门
偏离常规地做，不合要求地做

jx.jx_en_mean: another way of saying step down below
mentally withdraw from a situation in order to consider it objectively
jx.jx_cn_mean: 退一步以便更客观地思考

entry.def: If you take a step, you lift your foot and put it down in a different place, for example when you are walking.

example.ex: I took a step towards him...
example.tran: 我朝他迈了一步。

example.ex: She walked on a few steps...
example.tran: 她继续走了几步。

entry.def: If you step on something or step in a particular direction, you put your foot on the thing or move your foot in that direction.

example.ex: This was the moment when Neil Armstrong became the first man to step on the Moon...
example.tran: 就在此刻，内尔·阿姆斯特朗成了首位登上月球的人。

example.ex: She accidentally stepped on his foot on a crowded commuter train...
example.tran: 她在拥挤的通勤列车上不小心踩到了他的脚。

entry.def: Steps are a series of surfaces at increasing or decreasing heights, on which you put your feet in order to walk up or down to a different level.

example.ex: This little room was along a passage and down some steps...
example.tran: 这个小房间在沿着走廊再下几级台阶的地方。

example.ex: A flight of stone steps leads to the terrace.
example.tran: 一段石阶通向露台。

entry.def: A step is a raised flat surface in front of a door.

example.ex: A little girl was sitting on the step of the end house...
example.tran: 一个小女孩正坐在最顶头那幢房子门前的平台上。

example.ex: Leave empty milk bottles on the step.
example.tran: 将空奶瓶放在门阶上。

entry.def: A step is one of a series of actions that you take in order to achieve something.

example.ex: He greeted the agreement as the first step towards peace...
example.tran: 他称该协定是通向和平的第一步。

example.ex: She is not content with her present lot and wishes to take steps to improve it...
example.tran: 她对自己目前的生活并不满意，希望能采取措施改善它。

entry.def: A step in a process is one of a series of stages.

example.ex: The next step is to put the theory into practice...
example.tran: 下一步是要将理论付诸实践。

example.ex: Aristotle took the scientific approach a step further.
example.tran: 亚里士多德将该科学方法向前推进了一步。

entry.def: The steps of a dance are the sequences of foot movements which make it up.
Someone's step is the way they walk.

example.ex: He quickened his step...
example.tran: 他加快了步伐。

example.ex: There was a real spring in her step.
example.tran: 她的步子非常轻快。

entry.def: If you stay one step ahead of someone or something, you manage to achieve more than they do or avoid competition or danger from them.

example.ex: Successful travel is partly a matter of keeping one step ahead of the crowd...
example.tran: 成功的旅行在某种程度上就是要比人群先走一步。

example.ex: Businessmen cluster together to get ideas, tips, personal contacts anything to get a step ahead of the computer.
example.tran: 商人们聚集在一起寻求创意、建议、人际关系等，以便能比计算机领先一步。

entry.def: If people who are walking or dancing are in step, they are moving their feet forward at exactly the same time as each other. If they are out of step, their feet are moving forward at different times.
entry.tran: 步伐整齐/步伐不整齐;合拍/不合拍

example.ex: They were almost the same height and they moved perfectly in step...
example.tran: 他们几乎一样高，而且走路时步调完全一致。

example.ex: They jogged in silence a while, faces lowered, out of step...
example.tran: 他们低着头，一言不发地慢跑了一会儿，步伐也不一致。

entry.def: If people are in step with each other, their ideas or opinions are the same. If they are out of step with each other, their ideas or opinions are different.
entry.tran: (想法、意见等)与…一致/与…不一致

example.ex: Moscow is anxious to stay in step with Washington...
example.tran: 俄罗斯政府迫切希望和美国政府保持一致。

example.ex: The British Government is once more out of step with world opinion.
example.tran: 英国政府的观点再一次和世界舆论出现分歧。

entry.def: If you tell someone to step on it, you are telling them to go faster or hurry up.

example.ex: We've only got thirty-five minutes so step on it.
example.tran: 我们只有 35 分钟了，快点。

entry.def: If you do something step by step, you do it by progressing gradually from one stage to the next.

example.ex: I am not rushing things and I'm taking it step by step...
example.tran: 我不会仓促行事，我会一步一步地来。

example.ex: Follow our simple step-by-step instructions.
example.tran: 按照我们简单的说明，一步一步来。

entry.def: If someone tells you to watch your step, they are warning you to be careful about how you behave or what you say so that you do not get into trouble.

means.word_mean: 1. any maneuver made as part of progress toward a goal;

sentences.sentence: "the police took steps to reduce crime"

means.word_mean: 2. the distance covered by a step;

sentences.sentence: "he stepped off ten paces from the old tree and began to dig"

means.word_mean: 3. the act of changing location by raising the foot and setting it down;
4. support consisting of a place to rest the foot while ascending or descending a stairway;
5. relative position in a graded series;
6. a short distance;

sentences.sentence: "it's only a step to the drugstore"

means.word_mean: 7. the sound of a step of someone walking;
8. a musical interval of two semitones
9. a mark of a foot or shoe on a surface;

sentences.sentence: "the police made casts of the footprints in the soft earth outside the window"

means.word_mean: 10. a solid block joined to the beams in which the heel of a ship's mast or capstan is fixed
11. a sequence of foot movements that make up a particular dance;
1. shift or move by taking a step;
2. put down or press the foot, place the foot;

sentences.sentence: "For fools rush in where angels fear to tread"

means.word_mean: 3. cause (a computer) to execute a single command
4. treat badly;

sentences.sentence: "She is always stepping on others to get ahead"

means.word_mean: 5. furnish with steps;

sentences.sentence: "The architect wants to step the terrace"

means.word_mean: 6. move with one's feet in a specific manner;
7. walk a short distance to a specified place or in a specified manner;
8. place (a ship's mast) in its step
9. measure (distances) by pacing;
10. move or proceed as if by steps into a new situation;

sentences.sentence: "She stepped into a life of luxury"
"he won't step into his father's footsteps"

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English stape, stepe (noun), stappan, steppan (verb), of Germanic origin; related to Dutch steppen and German stapfen

means: Scientific and Technical Exploitation Program <美>科学技术开发计划
